pages.text: A Robit is a very helpful little companion. It acts like a minecraft pet.$(p)To spawn your own Robit, simply press $(k:use) on a $(l:machines/chargepad)Chargepad$(/l) with the Robit equipped in your hands. This $(l:machines/chargepad)Chargepad$(/l) will now act as the spawn point for your Robit when it is told to go home or if it runs out of power.
The Robit has multiple different convenient abilities, all of which can be accessed in its GUI.

pages.title: Abilities
pages.text: $(bold)Crafting$()$(br)The Robit has a 3x3 crafting grid that acts like a normal Crafting Table.$(p)To access it, press the button that has a crafting grid icon on it in the Robit's GUI. The button should read "Robit Crafting".

pages.title: Abilities
pages.text: $(bold)Storage$()$(br)The Robit has an internal inventory with 27 slots, equal to that of a single minecraft Chest. It's kinda like a backpack.$(p)To access it, press the button that has a chest icon on it in the Robit's GUI. The button should read"Robit Inventory".

pages.title: Abilities
pages.text: $(bold)Smelting$()$(br)The Robit has a built-in furnace too! It requires no combustible, e.g. coal. Instead, it uses power as fuel similar to a $(l:machines/energized_smelter)Energized Smelter$(/l).$(p)To access, press the button that has a furnace icon on it in the Robit's GUI. The button should read "Robit Smelting".

pages.title: Abilities
pages.text: $(bold)Anvil$()$(br)The Robit has an anvil feature as well! Like a normal anvil, it can repair, rename, and so on and so forth with the cost of experience.$(p)To access, press the button that has an anvil icon on it in the Robit's GUI. The button should read "Robit Repair".

pages.title: Misc. Features
pages.text: $(bold)Teleport back home$()$(br)Pressing this button will teleport the Robit back to its spawn point (the $(l:machines/chargepad)Chargepad$(/l) you spawned it on).$(p)$(bold)Toggle drop pickup mode$()$(br)Pressing this button will toggle on/off auto-pickup mode. If enabled, the Robit will automatically walk over and pick up dropped items and store them in its inventory.

pages.title: Misc. Features
pages.text: $(bold)Rename this Robit$()$(br)Pretty self-explanatory. Press this button to rename your Robit.$(p)$(bold)Toggle follow mode$()$(br)Press this button to toggle on/off follow mode. If enabled, the Robit will follow you and teleport to you if you are too far, similar to a minecraft pet.
